column3: Thanks for including steps to reproduce. Those should be trivial to translate to our python test suite.\n\nMind to add a commit with the new test?

Why isn't this using LastCommonAncestor/FindFork or equivalent? I believe doing that would give precisely the correct behavior.\n\n(Aside: Good find. I had just assumed this was doing the LCA thing. :( )
@gmaxwell Nice! I didn't realize it existed. `FindFork` works like a charm.

Looks like improvement, but I'm not sure it fixes all the issues: if a transaction was confirmed on the "since" block, and no longer is, we should include it in the results even if it did not change between the fork-point and tip.
@luke-jr Yeah, a double spend of the same UTXO will result in no transaction showing up, which is definitely not ideal..
Nit: It is sufficient to only import what you need. (E.g. `assert_equal`)\n\nAlso, `+x` is missing on the permissions of this file.
